intro: Impatiens deludens, commonly known as the deceptive impatiens, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the genus Impatiens in the family Balsaminaceae, characterized by its showy, often brightly colored flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers are usually spurred, with a unique shape that aids in pollination by specific insect species. The leaves are simple, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive botanical appearance.
